name: Grand Hotel La Chiusa di Chietri

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked for 2 nights at the beginning of a holiday exploring the Puglia region . We chose this hotel as it looked tas if it had a traditional and modren combination. We were taken in by the lovely photos showing traditional houses of the area. The reality was quite different. The first room we were given was the most depressing hotel room I have ever been in. In was on the first floor of the modern block, it was furnished in dark red and gold cheap looking furnishing and horrible cheap looking furniture the walls were bare . The curtains (and horrible nets ) were drawn so on a lovely day it was so gloomy . The view was a concrete wall opposite. We asked to be moved and were given the same room , same furnishings with a small dirty balcony over looking a building site where a pack of wild dogs procreated . We decided to check out the following morning and loose the cost of the second night already paid. We discussed this with reception who were disinterested . As it was late and we were tired we ate in the hotel and were pleasantly suprised the food was good and the outdoor dining space was pretty. The outdoor swimming pool was nice . Breakfast was served in what can only be described as a windowless conference room with false lighting the breakfast was dreadful and the room was shocking for a hotel of this standard . We could have been anywhere there was no sense of Italy and it really felt like a impersonal hotel. In the morning there were buisiness people meeting in the hotel and the public area was taken over with this.
reviews.title: We booked for 2 nights and stayed for one

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We moved, on after one night the following 3 hotels we stayed in were of similar cost but a far more positive experience .
reviews.title: Trulli fine !

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at this hotel as clients of Page & Moy and were in the main, pleased with our choice.
reviews.title: Very disappointing and with poor service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: As we were out almost every day of our stay on pre-booked coach excursions we were not duly bothered by the site of the hotel which is isolated but in beautiful countryside some 4 km. from Alberobello. It would have been nice to have somewhere to wander after dinner, but on those occasions when we travelled under our own steam we found that the mini-coach provided by the hotel was both prompt,and relatively cheap.
reviews.title: A Great Discovery

likes.liked: — Individuality, we stayed in a modernised trulli house in the hotel grounds
likes.disliked: — bathroom was a bit cramped and lack of clothes storage

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: The meals were tasty, but quite obviously costed for a coach tour.We were able to choose not from the a la carte menu but from a somewhat truncated variant. There were also some grumbles from our party regarding the service in the restaurant possibly a result of catering for a number of large tour parties.Breakfast was fine with plenty of buffet style choice and my cappuccino arrived promptly after ordering.
reviews.title: What luxury!!

likes.liked: — The pool and pool area are stellar!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Good Size Rooms. Comfortable large beds. Quite nice gardens.Nice pool.
reviews.title: Remote Spot

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: Downside was Hotel in the middle of no-where,busy roads either side. Staff unfriendly,especially in the restaurant,never smiled or came when you asked them.Food not too good,extremely small portions. The entrance to the grounds was very scruffy,rubble,water tanks and view from the rooms unattractive with weeds and bricks and mess. No tea & coffee facilities in the rooms either. Dust on the furniture in the corridors,we marked our name on the table ,but it was still there at the end of the week! We were just a number,they didn't treat us like guests on a holiday!
reviews.title: A great place to stay in Puglia

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked the hotel direct throught the contact details on the website, it was very easy but slow in replying to our request. When we arrived the place was a miniture paradise in a beautiful setting. We explored Puglia from there, you definatly need a car. Near was Alberobello with its historic trulli houses. On route to the coast to the hotels private beach location in Capitolo near Monopoli. The place is called PelleRossa, well this has changing facilities, bar, loungers and a restaurant with fresh pasta and ice cold drinks. There are plenty of places to visit and soak up the Puglian lifestyle - Ostuni with its historic white town pearched on the top of the hill, Fasano with the Zoo Safari (my children enjoyed the visit and the dolphin show) and then the breath taking town of Poligniano a Mare. Back to the hotel every afternoon to enjoy the pool and round sun sunbeds, enjoyed with a Aperol Spritz cocktail mixed at the bar. Dinner was great with a choice from an A la Carte menu, fresh pasta each night followed by a selection of Meat or Fish then fruit or a Italian dessert. Each night we ate outside in the courtyard with live soft music and candle light. The staff were very helpfull but on a Sunday its a bit more hectic with the Puglian buffet instead of the normal A la Carte. The hotel also has a small trulli village which you can stay in too. We will definalty return.
reviews.title: Relaxing venue but we loved having a car!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009
reviews.text: The hotel is lovely - great staff although it helps if you try to speak a little Italian to them (it's not overly commercalised so some staff don't speak English). The hotel rooms are spacious - we don't recomment the rooms with balconies as the hotel is still doing expansion work so the view from the balconies is less than salubrious! No building noise though - we thought they could be adding shops which would be a good idea. It would be lovely if there were somewhere to walk to in the evening but you are surrounded by countryside - lovely by day, lonely by night...although hotel bar prices were not over priced. Nice pool area with free sunbeds/mattresses although pool bar closed in September - this shows how good the staff were - we booked coffe for 1130 and they delivered it to the pool - quite a walk with a tray! Take time to walk round the hotel grounds - the gardens were lovely.
reviews.title: Enjoyed every minute of our stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The food was good - recommend half board pre-paid - half the price of paying on the spot.
reviews.title: We were staying on our honeymoon and the Hotel & staff made the whole experience totally magical.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This place just looks ugly - there is no outlook or apparent entrance or welcome as you approach. It is simply a concrete box. The wings of the building with bedrooms are designed that you simply look across at your adjacent wing and see the other ugly part of the building.
reviews.title: An architectural horror story

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012
reviews.text: WHilst it was reasonably clean it could do with an update and deep cleanse. There was always a faint musty smell that was hard to place!
reviews.title: Downgrade!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: I strongly reccomend that you do not eat in this hotel. There are large coach partys and weddings that must stratch the kitchen to its maximum. This means that those second class guests in the restaurant are simply given what is on the coach party buffet table - probably paying extra for it also. I could not believe that the first course pasta dish was so obvisouly made from frozen fish and poor quality pasta. I was not on a coach trip but was made to think so.
reviews.title: Busy Busy Busy

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff were reasonably polite in the restaurants but with the other parties in residence it was always a feeling of second best to them. If you like to sit at tables with 9 other awful coach trippers and eat second-rate pseudo Italian food of dubious quality then go.
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel but you need transport

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The pool does not open fully until June - even though of me the mid 20s we had were adequate. It was difficult even getting a cushion or towel for use at the pool ( and you are charged if you do get soemone willing to supply!)
reviews.title: Good hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is an attractive hotel with spacious comfortable rooms and a superb outdoor pool. But it is out in the sticks so there is nowhere to get to without a car or taxi. The dining room is well organised, but regimented to cater to groups of different nationalities - there were as many as 3 coaches there at once. We had to sit always in the same place and order dinner 24 hours in advance. The food was promptly served, but quality was variable. I was surprised that the only main course meat offered was veal for 6 out of 7 nights. I felt sorry for the outnumbered private guests who had to endure a lot of noise. The hotel is popular for wedding receptions and there was one there every day, with 2 on Saturday. The music may be heard in some of the bedrooms, but ours was very quiet.
reviews.title: A good hotel but only for package holidays

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Actually it was probably end of June last year (2010), the last Page and Moy tour to that area because of temperatures which soared to 40 degrees while we were there. I always meant to review the place because the outside, the part that isn't Trullis, and which looks a bit like a nuclear facility, so misrepresents the inside. It is a very large hotel but so well designed that you don't feel it. All the rooms for our tour were first rate, and had balconies looking over the landscape. The food was first rate, interesting, and the service good, particularly considering the number of people being served. A lot of people came there for dinner just because it was self-evidently good. I guess it might be expensive for individuals, but as we were within a tour, we were not aware of that nor did we feel we had a particularly restricted menu. They also catered for weddings in a different part of the hotel and which did not impinge at all on ones sleep etc. I can only speak for the part of the hotel we were in. The swimming pool was big and felt quite glorious given the heat. I remember it with fondness! Unless the place has changed hands I imagine it will be just as good.
reviews.title: Don't go by the appearance!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here as the point of accommodation for a Page and Moy Holiday. The room (one with a balcony) was comfortable and spacious with very effective air conditioning. The public areas were equally good. The food was above average. Free wi fi access but it did not work well much away from the reception area.
reviews.title: An excellent hotel with first class facilities

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is in the countryside, some way from the nearest town/village. A bookable shuttle service is available. We didn't use it (didn't need to due to nature of our P & M holiday) but the cost quoted seemed reasonable.
reviews.title: Suoerior Rooms not worth it

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011
reviews.text: We paid extra for a superior room expecting to be given a Trulli.We were not. We were given a room at the end of the hotel overlooking the car park . The rooms on the top floor with a balcony were very good and the extra for the superior room was not worth it Ask for room even numbers only 252 to 282 and you will get a nice room with a balcony overlooking the garden.Rooms 200 to 234 also overlook the garden with a balcony. The other standard rooms do not have a balcony or overlook the garden. Superior rooms 290 295 240 245 overlook the car park and are not worth the extra as the basic rooms as above are very good. Hotel very nice good food and lots of weddings to ogle at!
reviews.title: The restuarant manager Rocco was very accommodating for last minute requests.
